content:
Zulip desktop seems to weirdly interleave comments from topics. Consider this screenshot:

Capture.png

Is this the intended behavior? It seems odd for the feed to bounce back and forth between two different discussions, showing each reply under a comment from an unrelated thread.

There's also an arbitrarily large region of empty space between the input box and the comments (and the adjacent comment is not even from the thread that I am replying to). Other chat apps generally keep related comments together. So I was wondering about the rationale behind this design.

This is a stream view - you can zoom into (view) one of the topics by clicking on its title. There are shortcut keys for this - s/S will zoom in/out (in zulip-terminal we also added z for this to toggle in/out). In the webapp (and presumably desktop?) you can do alt-left/right to go back/forward between views too, just like going through web page history.
